section1.title:
Multi-Chain

Acceleration & Seamless Interoperability
section1.content: AIL2 provides 100x faster decentralized AI development across ETH, BSC, GIWA, XLayer, Base, and Mantle. It overcomes single-chain limitations for seamless multi-chain operations.Enables effortless cross-chain AI application deployment without technical barriers. Innovatively streamlines workflows, ensuring efficient and scalable cross-chain AI integration.

section2.title:
GPU-Driven

Decentralized Computing Power
section2.item1: Powered by a GPU miner network, AIL2 eliminates developer burdens in AI model deployment and maintenance.
section2.item2: The decentralized GPU infrastructure offers on-demand,scalable computing resources for AI operations.
section2.item3: It innovatively repurposes crypto mining resources for AI tasks.
section2.item4: This creates a cost-effective and high-performance computing solution.

section3.title:
Decentralized

Storage with Infinite Scalability
section3.content: The integrated AI Compute & Storage Network provides decentralized, infinitely scalable data storage. Data is distributed across the network for enhanced security and availability. It supports massive AI datasets with robust infrastructure. This design aligns with Web3 native principles,enabling unconstrained growth of AI applications.

section4.title: Web3 Data Synergy & Composability
section4.item1: AIL2 enables seamless integration of Web3 data (on-chain, DAO,etc.) into AI models via its unified architecture.
section4.item2: This synergy empowers innovative AI-driven Web3 use cases.
section4.item3: Examples range from on-chain analysis to autonomous agent operations.
section4.item4: It bridges AI capabilities with Web3 data ecosystems,expanding application boundaries.

section4.title: Accelerate Decentralized AI Development 100x
section4.content: A platform designed to massively accelerate decentralized AI application development by providing fully decentralized and infinitely scalable AI models across multiple blockchains.
section4.item1: Decentralized & Scalable Core: Operates on a fully decentralized network with unlimited scalability for AI models.
section4.item2: Developer Acceleration: Empowers developers to build decentralized AI applications 100 times faster.
section4.item3: Multi-Chain Support: Provides native support for six major blockchains: ETH, BSC, GIWA, XLayer, Base, and Mantle.

q1.question: What is AIL2?
q1.answer: AIL2 is a decentralized AI application ecosystem built on a distributed GPU miner network and a cross-chain settlement layer. It acts as a standardized infrastructure solution empowering developers to deploy and scale decentralized AI applications across multiple blockchains efficiently.

q2.question: Which blockchains does AIL2 support?
q2.answer:
AIL2 supports a wide range of mainstream public chains, including:

1.Ethereum

2.BNB Chain

3.X Layer

4.Base

5.Mantle

6.GIWA

q3.question: What are the three core target customer segments for AIL2?
q3.answer:
AIL2 categorizes its users into three segments based on technical capability and needs:

1.AIL2 Core (Professional Developers): Teams with full Web3 and AI development capabilities who use the SDK and APIs for custom integration.

2.AIL2 Builder (IMO Mode): Developers with improved AI models but lacking smart contract experience, who use the platform for one-click token issuance and fundraising.

3.AIL2 Creator (IAO Mode): Non-technical creators who use visual interfaces to combine existing models into AI Agents and build communities.

q4.question: What is the core value proposition of AIL2?
q4.answer:
AIL2's value proposition centers on four pillars:

1.Decentralized GPU Network: Integrating global GPU resources into an elastic computing network.

2.Intelligent Routing: Low-latency and high-availability request distribution via multi-objective optimization.

3.Cross-Chain Settlement: Unified payment and reconciliation across different blockchains.

4.Demand-Bound Incentives: Binding miner rewards to real demand to suppress token inflation.

q5.question: Describe the four-layer architecture of AIL2.
q5.answer:
The system consists of:

1.Compute Layer: The physical foundation consisting of distributed GPU miner nodes running standardized software.

2.Network Layer: Handles request ingestion, routing decision-making (using Router and Scheduler), and data transport.

3.Settlement Layer: Manages metering receipt verification, fee billing, and cross-chain financial settlement.

4.Ecosystem Layer: The user-facing interface, including SDKs, the Builder platform (IMO), and the Creator platform (IAO).

q6.question: How does the intelligent routing system select the best GPU node?
q6.answer: The scheduler treats routing as a multi-objective optimization problem. It filters nodes based on hard constraints (VRAM, Region, Availability) and then scores them based on soft constraints like Latency, Cost, and Quality. It utilizes an improved UCB (Upper Confidence Bound) algorithm to balance exploiting known high-performing nodes and exploring potentially undervalued new nodes.

q7.question: What are IMO and IAO?
q7.answer:
They are mechanisms to lower barriers for entry:

1.IMO(Initial Model Offering): A one-stop fundraising mechanism for model developers to issue tokens, register models, and gain initial computing power support.

2.IAO (Initial Agent Offering): A similar mechanism for non-technical creators to launch AI Agent applications using templates and issue project tokens for community building.

q8.question: How does billing and settlement work in AIL2?
q8.answer: After inference, nodes generate cryptographically signed Usage Receipts. AIL2 supports hybrid billing (Token-based for text, Time-based for media). To reduce costs, receipts are aggregated into Merkle Trees for batch settlement. Payment can occur via Multi-Chain Local Settlement (independent contracts per chain) or a Main Settlement Chain mode (using cross-chain bridges).

q9.question: What security measures are in place to prevent cheating?
q9.answer:
AIL2 employs a multi-faceted security approach:

1.Risk Scoring: Real-time assessment of participant behavior.

Penalty Mechanism: Reduced weights or service suspension for high-risk nodes.

2.Slashing: Economic penalties (stake deduction) for severe violations like forged receipts, replay attacks, or malicious results.

3.Verifiable Inference: A roadmap evolving from random spot-checks to redundant execution and eventually Zero-Knowledge Proofs (ZKP).

q10.question: What is the governance structure of AIL2?
q10.answer:
Governance is divided into three components:

1.Community Governance:. Token stakers vote on general parameters and treasury allocation.

2.Security Council:. A multi-sig group responsible for emergency responses to attacks or critical bugs.

3.Parameter Committee: Experts who propose technical parameter adjustments (e.g., routing weights) for community approval.

q11.question: What are the hardware requirements for miners?
q11.answer: Miners must provide enterprise-grade GPUs (Nvidia A100, H100, or RTX 4090) with high-bandwidth interconnects to meet the AIL2 Core performance SLA.

q12.question: How does AIL2 handle model privacy?
q12.answer: AIL2 supports TEE-based (Trusted Execution Environments) containers for models that require weights or inputs to remain encrypted throughout the inference cycle.

q13.question: Can I customize the billing policy for my model?
q13.answer: Yes. Developers can define custom pricing per token, per GPU second, or per inference task directly in the model registration contract.

Research.title:
The Decentralized

AI Operating System
Research.subtitle: AIL2 bridges the gap between massive compute requirements and distributed blockchain consensus, scaling intelligence to infinity.

item1.title: Hyper-Scalable Consensus
item1.description: Current blockchain layers cannot handle the throughput required for real-time model training. AIL2 introduces a <theme>novel sharding mechanism</theme> that treats AI model states as fluid data packets.

item2.title: Zero-overhead GPU Virtualization
item2.description: Zero-overhead GPU Virtualization We eliminate the friction between crypto-mining and AI inference. Our <theme>"GPU Driver" protocol</theme> acts as a universal translation layer, allowing raw compute power to be instantly provisioned.

item3.title: Fluid Composability Engine
item3.description: Developers shouldn't need to rebuild the stack. AIL2 provides a <theme>universal API surface</theme> that lets you chain together distinct AI agents and verified datasets.

item1.title: Verifiable Inference (PoI)
item1.description: Ensuring that decentralized models return correct results. We utilize <theme>Optimistic ZK-Rollups</theme> to cryptographically verify that the compute performed by an untrusted node matches the expected model execution path.
item1.dialogText1: Detailed technical documentation on Zero-Knowledge Proofs for Machine Learning (ZKML) is available.
item1.dialogText2:
The PoI protocol ensures:

1. Deterministic Execution

2. Cryptographic Weight Verification

3. Slashing conditions for dishonest nodes.

item2.title: Dynamic State Channels for Agents
item2.description: To support multi-agent systems, we implement <theme>ephemeral state channels</theme> that allow agents to negotiate, debate, and exchange data off-chain with near-zero latency, settling only the final consensus on-chain.
item2.dialogText1:
Our State Channels use a dual-layer approach:

- Layer 1: Settlement & Dispute Resolution

- Layer 2: High-frequency Agent Interaction
item2.dialogText2: This allows agents to trade context and inference results millions of times per second without gas fees.

item3.title: Universal Model Standardization
item3.description: A protocol-level standard for packaging AI models (Weights + Config + Inference Code) into a <theme>single portable asset</theme> that can be deployed across any AIL2-compatible node in seconds.
item3.dialogText2: Every .ail container requires a strict manifest defining hardware constrains.

section3.title:
New Blockchain System Empowered by

Multi-Agent Technology
section3.subtitle: LLM-based multi-agent systems coordinate complex tasks through distributed intelligence, perfectly aligning with blockchain architecture.

item1.title: Autonomous Smart Contract Management
item1.description: Smart contracts are critical for automating transactions. We implement a multi-agent solution where distinct agents analyze, security-audit, and optimize smart contract logic in real-time, augmenting the chain with self-healing capabilities.

item2.title: Decentralized Anomaly Detection
item2.description: To prevent malicious interference during execution, we deploy a "Watchdog Swarm"—a system of specialized agents that continuously monitor consensus mechanisms. By coordinating their observations, they enhance the trustworthiness of the entire environment.

Core.title: Build decentralized AI apps on a <theme>distributed GPU network</theme>
Core.description: Integrate via SDK & contracts. AIL2 handles routing, scheduling, receipts, settlement, and miner incentives—so you ship faster across Ethereum, BNB Chain, XLayer, Base, Mantle, and GIWA.

card2.title: Receipts & Settlement
card2.description: Auditable receipts + batch settlement + auto split

card3.title: Cross-chain Native
card3.description: One integration, serve users across chains

coreStack.title: A protocol-grade core stack for decentralized AI.

CoreProtocol.title: Core Protocol Capabilities
CoreProtocol.description: A modular stack designed for high-throughput AI inference.

card1.title: Router & Scheduler
card1.description: Predict queue time, score nodes, retry/fallback automatically across the entire decentralized mesh.

card2.title: Model Containers
card2.description: Versioning, canary rollout, rollback. Miners pull your custom images and run them in secure isolated environments.

card3.title: Usage Receipts
card3.description: Signed receipts with token counts, GPU seconds, and fees. Merkle batch proofs ensure absolute auditability.

card4.title: AIL2 Settlement
card4.description: Batch finalize inference proofs with a dispute window and automatic revenue distribution to token holders.

card5.title: SLA & Reputation
card5.description: Real-time monitoring of node success rates and p95 latency. Reputation scores affect routing priority.

card6.title: Security & Anti-fraud
card6.description: Risk-weighted rewards and automated slashing for forged receipts or duplicated work detection.

Settlement.title: From Request to Settlement
Settlement.description: The lifecycle of a decentralized inference request.
Settlement.item1: Request initiated via SDK/Gateway with project credentials.
Settlement.item2: Router validates authorization, rate-limits, and checks credit balance.
Settlement.item3: Scheduler selects optimal GPU node based on latency and reputation.
Settlement.item4: Container executes inference and returns signed result + receipt.
Settlement.item5: Receipt is batched into Merkle tree for Layer 2 settlement and split payment.
Settlement.subDescription: Everything is measurable, auditable, and programmable.

Docs.title: Documentation
Docs.description: Technical guides, API references, and architecture overviews for the AIL2 network.

introduction.title: Introduction to AIL2
introduction.description: AIL2 is a Layer 2 scaling solution specifically designed for Artificial Intelligence workloads. It bridges gap between massive compute requirements and distributed blockchain consensus, scaling intelligence to infinity.
introduction.note: <text>Note:</text> AIL2 Mainnet Beta is currently live. Developers can begin deploying models to our distributed GPU network immediately.

sdk.title: 1. SDK Installation
sdk.text1: To start developing with AIL2, please install our core SDK and its peer dependencies. The SDK provides all the tools needed to interact with the AIL2 network, submit inference tasks, and manage models.
sdk.text2: After installation, you can import the SDK into your project and configure your Project ID and API Key for initialization:

quickstart.title: 2. Ship in 5 Minutes
quickstart.text: After obtaining your project_id from the Developer Console, you can start building with a single API call. Here is a complete example of submitting an inference task to the nebula-ai model:

inference.title: Proof of Inference
inference.description: The core consensus mechanism of the AIL2 network. Through Optimistic ZK-Rollup technology, it cryptographically verifies that the process of untrusted computing nodes executing AI models matches expectations exactly, ensuring the correctness of decentralized inference results and providing the incentive basis for honest nodes.

stateChannels.title: State Channels
stateChannels.description: An efficient off-chain transaction layer designed for infinite scalability. It allows users to perform high-frequency, low-cost micro-transactions and state interactions outside the AIL2 Core Rollup, syncing with the underlying blockchain only upon final settlement, greatly enhancing the composability and user experience of AI applications.

token.title: Token Economics
token.description: The incentive layer of the AIL2 ecosystem. Tokens are used to pay for network compute resources (GPU), stake to become validator nodes, participate in governance, and reward participants who provide computing power, storage, and verification services to the network, driving the continuous operation of the entire decentralized AI network.

api.title: 4. API REFERENCE
api.text1: The core endpoint for submitting AI model inference tasks.
api.text2: Response: Returns a JSON object containing task_id, status, and asynchronous results.
api.col2: The ID of the model to invoke (e.g., nebula-ai).
api.col3: Model-specific input data, usually containing fields like prompt.
api.col4: Optional inference parameters, such as temperature, max_tokens.
api.text3: The endpoint to query the list of available AI models or get specific model details.
api.col5: Specify the Model ID to get its detailed information. If omitted, the list is returned.
api.text4: Response: Returns a model array or a single model object, containing metadata such as ID, name, description, input/output formats, etc.

bill.title: 5. Billing & Usage
bill.description: AIL2 adopts a pay-as-you-go billing model. Fees are calculated based on the complexity of the AI model invoked, the GPU compute duration consumed (in seconds), and the volume of data processed (number of input/output tokens).

item1.title: View Usage & Balance
item1.description: You can view real-time details of resource consumption, remaining credits, and historical bills for your current project in the 'Billing' panel of the Developer Console.

item2.title: Billing Alerts
item2.description: The system will send an email alert when your credit falls below the set threshold, ensuring your AI service is not interrupted due to insufficient balance.

bill.text: Currently supports settlement via AIL2 native tokens on the following six mainstream blockchains, fully leveraging AIL2's multi-chain advantage as a unified AI super layer:
